DOC.brief_summary: This study proposes a simple and safe way of lowering this complicate rate, while improving graft recovering and protecting the graft as it recovers from the transplant. The investigators hypothesize that by maintaining a tight glucose control via a glucose-insulin clamp during surgery and 72 hours post-operatively the investigators will be able to lower the complication rate by 50%.
DOC.brief_title: Hyperinsulinemic Normoglycemic Clamp for Pancreas and Simultaneous Pancreas/Kidney Transplant Recipients
DOC.criteria: Male or female patient over 18 years of age Patient is about to receive a pancreas or a simultaneous pancreas/kidney transplant Able to give written informed consent prior to any study specific procedure Multiorgan transplant other than kidney transplant No central venous access available to deliver the D20W solution
DOC.keyword: Pancreas and Simultaneous Pancreas/Kidney Transplant Recipients
